intro: Octomeria mauritii, commonly known as the Mauritius octomeris, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. Octomeria mauritii is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat.
